  • Method Details

    • instantiate

      public static Controller instantiate()
      Instantiates a single instance of the Controller class using the Singleton design pattern. If the instance does not exist, a new Controller instance is created; otherwise, the existing instance is returned.
      Returns:
      The unique instance of the Controller class.

    • setPolicyManager

      public void setPolicyManager(PolicyManager policyManager) throws OperationNotValid
      Sets the PolicyManager for the Controller, affecting the invocation policy for registered actions. The provided PolicyManager must not be null; otherwise, an OperationNotValid exception is thrown. If the PolicyManager is successfully set, it is applied to each registered invoker associated with the Controller.
      Parameters:
      policyManager - The Policy Manager to be set for the Controller and invokers.
      Throws:
      OperationNotValid - If the provided PolicyManager is null.
      See Also:
      • PolicyManager

    • registerInvoker

      public void registerInvoker(InvokerInterface invoker) throws OperationNotValid
      Adds an invoker to the Controllers list of registered invokers.
      Parameters:
      invoker - The invoker to be registered.
      Throws:
      OperationNotValid - If the invoker received as a parameter is null or is already inside the list.

    • deleteInvoker

      public void deleteInvoker(InvokerInterface invoker) throws OperationNotValid
      Removes an invoker from the list of registered invokers.
      Parameters:
      invoker - The InvokerInterface to be removed.
      Throws:
      OperationNotValid - If the invoker passed as a parameter is null or is not inside the list.

    • getRegisteredInvokers

      public List<InvokerInterface> getRegisteredInvokers()
      Retrieves the list of registered invokers within the controller.
      Returns:
      The list of registered invokers.

    • registerAction

      public <T, R> void registerAction(String id, Function<T,R> invokable, long ram) throws OperationNotValid
      Registers an action with the Controller, associating it with a unique identifier (ID), a function (invokable), and the amount of RAM required for the invocation.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the input parameter for the invokable function.
      R - The type of the result returned by the invokable function.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier for the registered action.
      invokable - The function to be registered as an invokable action.
      ram - The amount of RAM required for the invocation of the action.
      Throws:
      OperationNotValid - If the provided invokable is null, the ID is null, or if the action is already registered.
      See Also:
      • Invokable
      • Function

    • deleteAction

      public void deleteAction(String id) throws OperationNotValid
      Deletes a registered action from the Controller based on its unique identifier (ID).
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the action to be deleted.
      Throws:
      OperationNotValid - If the provided ID is null or if no action is registered with the specified ID.

    • getAction

      public Object getAction(String id) throws OperationNotValid
      Retrieves the invokable action associated with the specified unique identifier (ID). Returns the invokable action as an Object.

      **Used for testing reasons**.

      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the action to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      The invokable action associated with the specified ID.
      Throws:
      OperationNotValid - If the provided ID is null or if no action is registered with the specified ID.

    • retrieveInvokable

      public <T, R> Invokable<T,R> retrieveInvokable(String id) throws OperationNotValid, NoActionRegistered
      Retrieves and returns the Invokable associated with the specified unique identifier (ID). The type parameters T and R indicate the input and result types of the retrieved Invokable.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the input parameter for the retrieved Invokable.
      R - The type of the result returned by the retrieved Invokable.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the action whose Invokable is to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      The Invokable associated with the specified ID.
      Throws:
      OperationNotValid - If the provided ID is null.
      NoActionRegistered - If the map of actions is empty or if no action is registered with the specified ID.
      See Also:
      • Invokable

    • invoke

      public <T, R> R invoke(String id, T args) throws Exception
      Prepares the policy manager and invokes synchronously an Invokable.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the input parameter for the action.
      R - The type of the result returned by the action.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier associated with the action.
      args - The input arguments for the action.
      Returns:
      The result of invoking the action.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an exception occurs during the invocation process.

    • invoke

      public <T, R> List<R> invoke(String id, List<T> args) throws Exception
      Synchronously invokes the action with the specified unique identifier (ID) using the Controller in a group invocation, passing a list of input arguments.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the input parameter for the action.
      R - The type of the result returned by the action.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier associated with the action.
      args - The list of input arguments for the group invocation.
      Returns:
      A list of results corresponding to the invocation of the action for each input element.
      Throws:
      OperationNotValid - If the provided list of input arguments is null or empty.
      Exception - If an exception occurs during the invocation process.

    • invoke_async

      public <T, R> Future<R> invoke_async(String id, T args) throws Exception
      Prepares the policy manager and invokes asynchronously an Invokable.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the input parameter for the action.
      R - The type of the result returned by the action.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier associated with the action.
      args - The input arguments for the action.
      Returns:
      The result of invoking the action.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an exception occurs during the invocation process.

    • invoke_async

      public <T, R> List<Future<R>> invoke_async(String id, List<T> args) throws Exception
      Asynchronously invokes the action with the specified unique identifier (ID) using the Controller in a group invocation, passing a list of input arguments.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the input parameter for the action.
      R - The type of the result returned by the action.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier associated with the action.
      args - The list of input arguments for the group invocation.
      Returns:
      A list of Future objects representing the asynchronous results of invoking the action for each input element.
      Throws:
      OperationNotValid - If the provided list of input arguments is null or empty.
      Exception - If an exception occurs during the asynchronous invocation process.

    • listActions

      public void listActions()
      Lists the available actions along with their allocated RAM.

    • shutdownAllInvokers

      public void shutdownAllInvokers() throws RemoteException
      Shuts down all registered invokers.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If a remote communication error occurs while shutting down an invoker.
